meanings.definition: A person who guarantees or promises something.
meanings.sent1: The warranter assured us that the product would work perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The warranter promised to fix any issues with the car within a year.
meanings.sent3: The warranter joked that he would guarantee sunshine every day if he could.
meanings.sent4: She was like a warranter of good luck, always ensuring things went smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The warranter's word was as solid as a rock, never failing to deliver on promises.

meanings.definition: A person who provides a warranty for a product or service.
meanings.sent1: The warranter included a one-year warranty with the new laptop.
meanings.sent2: As a warranter, he made sure customers could get a replacement if needed.
meanings.sent3: The warranter playfully suggested offering a lifetime warranty on socks.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to quality made her a warranter of trust in the company.
meanings.sent5: The warranter's guarantee was like a shield, protecting buyers from defects.
